articles.title: Senator Markey announces plans to file amendment on AI regulation
articles.author: Beck Wehner
articles.summary: State Senator Ed Markey (D-Mass.) plans to file an amendment to the Senate reconciliation bill to block Republicans' attempt to prevent states from regulating artificial intelligence in the next ten years. Senators in both parties have expressed an interest in regulating AI. Last Tuesday Senator Markey delivered remarks on the Senate floor opposing the reconciliation bill passed in the House.

articles.title: FlySafair launches Lindi, a new AI travel assistant
articles.summary: FlySafair has become the first airline in South Africa to launch a free AI-powered travel assistant named Lindi. Lindi was developed by Stubber, a tech company that specialises in AI solutions. It offers 24/7 support via WhatsApp. It can book flights for single passengers, change a name or seat on a booking and provide travel information. New bookings are limited to business class, infant, group, and travel agent bookings.

articles.title: Human8 names Tim Nguyen product and innovation manager to further advance insight solutions
articles.summary: Tim Nguyen has joined the product and innovation team at Human8 as product manager. He will focus on enhancing the tools and platforms that support deeper, more impactful connections between brands and people. Tim's previous work has already earned industry recognition, including a Young ESOMAR Society Award nomination.

articles.title: Proposed bill could bring AI interpretation to Wisconsin court system
articles.author: Grace Monk
articles.summary: A new bill would allow courts to use artificial intelligence during civil and criminal proceedings. The service would be used in addition to, or instead of human interpreters. Stewart Eskew, an Assistant Teaching Professor at UWL, says AI can be accurate as long as it has time to learn.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Sam Altman sends strong 2-word message on the future
articles.author: Colette Bennett
articles.summary: AI is taking over the tech industry and the news cycle. Sam Altman is the CEO of ChatGPT, which has three million paid subscribers. He wrote a blog post about AI and how it's changing our world. He predicts that in the 2030s, intelligence and energy will be wildly abundant.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Sam Altman sends strong 2-word message on the future
articles.author: Colette Bennett
articles.summary: about the AI boom and the fear that AI might take your job. It's difficult to explain to the average person, but it isn't hard to explain the concept of AI taking your job, as well as the fear it might take you job as well.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO: AI Won't Destroy Humanity — It Will Democratize Intelligence
articles.summary: Jensen Huang is the CEO of the world's most valuable chipmaker, Nvidia. Huang is in Paris for VivaTech and is scheduled to visit Germany and London Tech Week. Huang believes AI is a tool for liberation, not for domination. Huang's company is expanding its presence in Europe with new AI infrastructure projects.

articles.title: The New Role of AI Assistants in Work, Life, and Understanding
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes more integrated into daily life, automation tools have taken center stage. AI assistant technology is capable of automating routine tasks like scheduling, email drafting, and data entry. In many ways, AI assistants may be considered the most impactful productivity tool on the market.

articles.title: Australia news live: productivity commissioner warns of job cuts coming from AI; aged care provider ...
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Danielle Wood doubts AI will eliminate half of entry-level white-collar jobs in five years, but there will be some impacts. Former ambassador to the US Joe is sceptical about AI's potential to eliminate all white-collared jobs in 5 years.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence is getting tougher to spot in Kentucky: Media studies expert helps tell the difference
articles.author: Bode Brooks
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is getting harder to spot in the media space. Al Tompkins from the Poynter Institute for Media Studies explains how to avoid being tricked when something appears real online. He points out that disinformation mostly turns on emotion. Google unveiled an update to its generative video model, Veo 3, last month.

articles.title: Disney, Universal Slam AI Company As 'Bottomless Pit Of Plagiarism' In Scathing Lawsuit
articles.author: Pocharapon Neammanee
articles.summary: Disney and NBCUniversal joined forces in the first lawsuit of its kind against the artificial intelligence image company Midjourney on Wednesday, accusing it of copyright infringement. The AI company made $300 million last year from its image service, which allowed subscribers to request any of the Disney or Universal characters to perform an action. The companies are now asking for a jury trial to determine damages.

articles.title: The LA protests are drowning in AI slop
articles.author: CATHERINE KIM
articles.summary: The spread of falsified information, especially images, is emerging as a troubling issue in recent civil disturbances and demonstrations. Fake AI videos are the perfect medium for our rage-bait driven society, where people interact with content deliberately created to upset them. It's the reality of tribalism in 2025: Anger generates clicks and clicks spread the word.

articles.title: Pinterest AI: Shoppable Collages for Advertisers
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Pinterest is testing a new AI feature called 'auto-collages' which turns product catalogs into shoppable collages. It's designed to streamline the advertising process for businesses. Pinterest's move underscores the growing importance of AI in e-commerce advertising.

articles.title: Zuckerberg's Meta Just Made a Huge Investment in Very Dark AI Company
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg has invested $15 billion in Scale.ai, an AI startup accused of using slave labor to train chatbots. Mark Zuckerberg is recruiting 50 AI researchers for a secret society of AI developers. It is Meta's largest external investment to date. Scale.AI co-founder Alexandr Wang is set to join the secret society.

articles.title: Each ChatGPT query uses 0.34 watt-hours, 0.000085 gallons of water
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI, has disclosed that a single ChatGPT query consumes about 0.34 watt-hours of electricity and 0.000085 gallons of water per query. Each Chat GPT query uses 0.4 WONTHILLS of electricity.

articles.title: 'Yuck': Wikipedia pauses AI summaries after editor revolt
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Generative AI is permeating the Internet. Wikipedia is looking to add AI to its Wikipedia articles. It's already a vast repository of knowledge maintained by an army of volunteer human editors.    .   i   for more information visit Wikipedia.org.

articles.title: AI accelerates intel work, JFK files released faster
articles.author: Marc Lutz
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard promotes use of private-sector AI over federal tools to speed up the work of America's intelligence services. Her office has released tens of thousands of pages of material related to the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and his brother, Sen. Robert Kennedy, on the orders of President Trump.

articles.title: CFP Board Convenes AI Working Group
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: CFP Board is convening an AI Working Group on June 10-11 at its Washington, D.C., headquarters to explore how artificial intelligence is transforming the financial planning ecosystem and define the evolving role of human expertise in a tech-powered future. The group is developing recommendations to guide the profession forward.

articles.title: UK Regulator Partners with Nvidia to Help Banks Test AI Tools
articles.author: Vardah Gill
articles.summary: Britain's financial regulator announced a partnership with the company to help banks explore artificial intelligence technologies. The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) will launch a new 'Supercharged Sandbox' in October. FCA noted that this program is intended for companies still in the early stage of AI adoption. NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) produces the graphics processing units (GPUs) that power the training and operation of advanced AI models. The stock has surged by nearly 4% since the start of 2025.

articles.title: Apple to Open its AI Models to App Developers
articles.author: Vardah Gill
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the best Dow stocks to invest in. The company is giving millions of app developers access to its AI models for the first time. Developers began testing the new features on June 9, with a broader rollout expected in the fall.

articles.title: Meta to spend about $15 billion to acquire AI company
articles.author: Vishnu Kaimal
articles.summary: Scale AI is a San Francisco-based artificial intelligence infrastructure company founded in 2016 by Alexandr Wang and Lucy Guo. It provides high-quality labeled data and model evaluation tools for training AI systems. Scale's services support a variety of sectors, including autonomous vehicles, national defense, finance, and large language models. Meta Platforms has agreed to take a 49% stake in Scale AI for $14.8 billion.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs wants students to stop using ChatGPT in job interviews with the bank
articles.author: Emma Burleigh
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs' campus recruitment team for the bank's private investing academy in EMEA sent out an email to students reminding them of its expectations for interviews. They are encouraged to prepare for interviews by studying the firm's financial results, business principles, and core values. They can't use AI during the interview. Anthropic and Amazon have warned their job-seekers against using AI during recruitment.

articles.title: Apple is salvaging Image Playground with a boost from ChatGPT
articles.author: Aisha Malik
articles.summary: Apple announced at WWDC that it's going to boost Image Playground with a ChatGPT integration. The app allows users to create personalized, original images with the help of Apple Intelligence. It's expected to launch alongside the release of iOS 26 this fall.

articles.title: The Big Beautiful Bill's Moratorium on AI Regulation Is Dangerous
articles.author: Keith Rothfus
articles.summary: 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act' includes a 10-year moratorium on state and local laws regulating artificial intelligence for the next decade. This is despite concerns about AI's negative impacts on children and communities. The Senate's proposal is substantively the same, but it bribes states to forgo enforcement of AI-related laws as a condition for receiving millions under the Federal broadband program.

articles.title: Unreal Editor for Fortnite's AI character creation tool has ambitions beyond Darth Vader
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Epic Games added a new version of Darth Vader in Fortnite that could speak with players. Later this year, any creator using Unreal Editor will be able to make their own AI-powered characters with the same underlying technology behind Vader. The Persona Device will allow anyone to create non-playable characters (NPCs) with AI-driven personalities.

articles.title: Posted Jun 11, 2025 at 4:51 PM EDT 0 Comments
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Koray Kavukcuoglu, Google DeepMind's chief technology officer, has been appointed a chief AI architect. He will work to combine Google's AI models with its products with the goal of more seamless integration, faster iteration and greater efficiency.

articles.title: Posted Jun 11, 2025 at 4:51 PM EDT
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Koray Kavukcuoglu, Google DeepMind's chief technology officer, has been appointed a chief AI architect. He will work to combine Google's AI models with its products with the goal of more seamless integration, faster iteration and greater efficiency.

articles.title: Meta Platforms (META) Bets Big on AGI With $10 Billion Push and New AI Dream Team
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is one of the 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. Mark Zuckerberg is setting up a team of experts to achieve 'artificial general intelligence' (AGI), or machines that can match or surpass human capabilities. Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang is expected to join the group after a deal is done.

articles.title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Gets Buy Rating as AI Data Center Demand Surges Past $50 Billion
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Bank of America reiterated the stock as 'Buy' for NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) on Tuesday, June 10. Hewlett-Packard Enterprise and Leibniz Supercomputing Centre are partnering to build a new supercomputer using Nvidia's next-generation chips.

articles.title: QUALCOMM (QCOM) to Acquire Alphawave for $2.4 Billion in Data Center Expansion Push
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: QCOM has agreed to buy semiconductor company Alphawave IP Group Plc for an estimated $2.4 billion in cash. The deal is subject to regulatory and shareholder approval and is expected to close in the first quarter of 2026. QCOM develops wireless technologies, supplies chips for mobile, automotive, and IoT devices, licenses patents, and invests in emerging industries worldwide.

articles.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Lands Surprise Win as OpenAI Picks Google Cloud for AI Expansion
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is one of the 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. On June 10, Reuters reported that OpenAI is planning to add Alphabet's Google cloud service to meet its needs for computing capacity. Scotiabank analysts have deemed the development to be 'somewhat surprising'

articles.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Lands Surprise Win as OpenAI Picks Google Cloud for AI Expansion
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is adding OpenAI's Google cloud service to meet its growing needs for computing capacity. OpenAI and Google are competitors in the artificial intelligence space. Scotiabank analysts have deemed the development to be 'somewhat surprising'

articles.title: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) to Power Fedrigoni's Digital Makeover with AI Solutions
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) has entered into a multi-year partnership with Fedrigoni, an Italian manufacturer of specialty papers for packaging and other applications. Palantir's innovative solutions and cutting-edge AI technology will expand to support Fedrigni's entire digital transformation.

articles.title: AI, drones, and data: Kansas invests in next-gen transportation
articles.summary: Governor Laura Kelly announced Tuesday that more than $4.5 million will be awarded to 20 projects across the state through the Kansas Department of Transportation's Innovative Technology Program. Some of the funded initiatives incorporate AI to streamline infrastructure assessments and traffic systems. The program also includes major aviation tech investments, such as $1 million for an advanced UAS (unmanned aerial systems) flight operations center at Kansas State University-Salina and $900,000 for aviation research at the Salina Regional Airport.

articles.title: Sam Altman Goes Off at AI Skeptic
articles.summary: Gary Marcus is an outspoken critic of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's AI hype. Altman claims Marcus overstates the potential of AI technology. Marcus is also a critic of the "scaling" model of AI development, where tech companies dump billions into ever-larger systems powered by more processing power and data.

articles.title: Oracle Revenue Surges: Beats Estimates
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Oracle's fourth-quarter revenue beat analysts' estimates by $15.90 billion. The company's strong performance is driven by demand for its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and AI capabilities. Oracle anticipates a significant acceleration in cloud growth, projecting a jump from 24% in fiscal year 2025 to over 40% by fiscal year 2026.

articles.title: CoreWeave reportedly a key player in Google-OpenAI partnership
articles.author: Vlad Schepkov
articles.summary: CoreWeave is set to provide computing capacity to Google Cloud as part of Google's newly formed partnership with OpenAI. CoreWeave will supply services built on Nvidia's graphics processing units to Google's cloud unit. Google will sell this capacity to OpenAI to meet the growing demand for services such as ChatGPT.

articles.title: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Teams Up with Ericsson to Power Edge AI with 5G Connectivity
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (NASDAQ:SMCI) is one of the 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. On June 10th, Super Micro Computer and Ericsson announced their intent to enter into a strategic collaboration to accelerate Edge AI deployment. The two parties signed a Memorandum of Understanding to explore the integration of Ericsson's 5G connectivity with Supermicro's industry-leading Edge AI platforms.

articles.title: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Teams Up with Ericsson to Power Edge AI with 5G Connectivity
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (NASDAQ:SMCI) is one of the 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. On Tuesday, June 10th, SMCI and Ericsson announced their intent to enter into a strategic collaboration that aims to accelerate Edge AI deployment.

articles.title: CFP Board Convenes AI Working Group
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: CFP Board is convening an AI Working Group on June 10-11 at its Washington, D.C., headquarters to explore how artificial intelligence is transforming the financial planning ecosystem. The group is developing strategic, actionable recommendations to guide the profession forward in an AI-powered world.

articles.title: Meta Hires Top Researchers From Google, Sesame for New AI Lab
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has poached top engineers from Google for a new team focused on achieving a more advanced form of AI called artificial general intelligence. The new team includes engineers from multiple tech firms, including Alphabet Inc.'s Google, for the new project.

articles.title: Nvidia chief calls AI ‘the greatest equalizer' - but warns Europe risks falling behind
articles.author: CTV
articles.summary: Will artificial intelligence save humanity or hurt humanity?    iReport.com will let you know what they think about artificial intelligence and its potential benefits or drawbacks. iReport is on Facebook.com/ArtificialIntelligence and on Twitter: @Artificialintelligence.

articles.title: Altman fluffs superintelligence to save humanity as OpenAI slashes prices
articles.author: Thomas Claburn
articles.summary: OpenAI's o3-Pro model for ChatGPTP Pro and Teams subscribers has been slashed by 80 percent. CEO Sam Altman claims AI is too cheap to meter. MIT Technology Review found that AI-specific purposes in data centers will consume between 165 and 326 terawatt-hours of energy in 2028.

articles.title: Nvidia chief calls AI ‘the greatest equalizer' — but warns Europe risks falling behind
articles.author: Messenger-Inquirer
articles.summary: Will artificial intelligence save humanity or destroy it? Jensen Huang, the global expert on artificial intelligence, answers that question in this article.    Jensen Huang is a professor at the University of California, Los Angeles.  iReport.com is on Facebook.

articles.title: Databricks open-sources declarative ETL framework powering 90% faster pipeline builds
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: With Apache Spark Declarative Pipelines, engineers describe what their pipeline should do using SQL or Python and Apache Spark handles the execution, and then it executes the description in Spark. Read more here: http://www.apacheapointalk.org/blog/2013/01/30/apache-spark-declarative-pipelines-demolishes-the-principals.html

articles.title: Zuckerberg & AI: Meta's Push for Artificial Superintelligence
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg made a reported $1 billion investment in Scale AI, a data labeling and AI infrastructure company. Scale AI provides the tools and platform for building and scaling AI models. Mark Zuckerberg wants to develop artificial superintelligence (ASI) in all aspects. The acquisition of Scale AI signals the emergence of AI factories.

articles.title: Cal Poly should rethink its messaging with ChatGPT Edu
articles.author: Mustang News
articles.summary: In their school-wide emails, Cal Poly has not warned students about the implications that AI usage has on the environment, as it does in their emails to the general public. It is not stated in the emails that AI is harmful to the environment. It's not mentioned in any of the emails.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Highlights NVIDIA CEO's GTC Paris Keynote Speech's Significance
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the 11 stocks on Jim Cramer's radar. Cramer noted that NVIDIA Corporation's CEO hinted at a possible deal that could help the company. NVIDIA provides advanced graphics, computing, and networking solutions, including GPUs, data center platforms, AI software and tools for robotics, gaming, automotive systems, and industrial applications.

articles.title: Disney and Universal sue AI firm for copyright infringement
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: Disney and Universal have filed a copyright lawsuit against popular artificial intelligence image-generator Midjourney on Wednesday. The complaint claims the company pirated the libraries of the two Hollywood studios to generate and distribute 'endless unauthorized copies' of their characters, such as Darth Vader from Star Wars and the Minions from Despicable Me.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Charts Path to Singularity
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: Microsoft-backed OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says we've already crossed the event horizon toward digital superintelligence. He predicts everyday robots will tackle real-world chores by 2027 and the 2030s will look nothing like today. Altman believes human ingenuity and emerging governance frameworks can steer us through the singularity.

articles.title: Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ) Declared Quarterly Dividend
articles.author: Vardah Gill
articles.summary: Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE:VZ) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.6775 per share on June 6. The company has increased its dividend for 18 straight years. In the most recent quarter, operating cash flow rose to $7.8 billion and free cash flow increased to $3.6 billion. VZ has surged by nearly 10% since the start of 2025.

articles.title: WSJ: Some Publishers Are Being Crushed by Google's Turn to AI
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.summary: Chatbots and Google's new 'AI Overview' feature are replacing conventional Google searches, which is negatively affecting website traffic for some online publishers. News outlets have also experienced a drop in online traffic amid the AI technology's increase in capability and usage. Business Insider cut 21 percent of its staff last month to cope with the decline.

articles.title: Put the paintbrush down – AI can restore artworks quicker and better
articles.author: Sarah Knapton
articles.summary: Alex Kachkine used AI to repair a 15th-century oil painting in 3.5 hours using 57,314 different colours. The new technique involves first scanning the painting and then using software to create maps of the areas that require repair. The maps are then inkjet printed onto two sheets of a film. The layers are carefully aligned and overlaid by hand onto the original painting.

articles.title: Still shopping? Get your pool-loving dad a robot pool vac on sale for $820 off
articles.author: Kasey Caminiti
articles.summary: Beatbot robotic pool vacuums are on sale for Father's Day with savings up to $820. The AquaSense 2 Ultra, Aqua Sense 2 Pro and the Aquasense 2 are featured in the sale. The three models are available for different pool sizes and features.

articles.title: Nvidia chief calls AI ‘the greatest equalizer' — but warns Europe risks falling behind
articles.author: Thomas Adamson
articles.summary: Jensen Huang is the global chip tycoon predicted to become one of the world's first trillionaires. He believes that artificial intelligence is a tool for liberation and not a threat to humanity as some claim. He is not worried about dystopia or domination.

articles.title: Nvidia chief calls AI ‘the greatest equalizer' — but warns Europe risks falling behind

articles.title: Meta unveils V-JEPA 2: AI model predicts real-world movement without video data
articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: Meta has launched a new artificial intelligence system called V-JEPA 2. The open-source model was revealed at the VivaTech conference in Paris. It mimics the human brain's ability to plan a course of action to accomplish a given task and transforms how machines understand and navigate the physical world.

articles.title: Trump AI czar hits back at ‘doomer cult' and mass-unemployment fears
articles.author: Ryan Struyk
articles.summary: David Sacks, White House AI czar, dismissed concerns about artificial intelligence taking away jobs on Tuesday. A major AI leader had warned that AI could lead to a 20% rise in unemployment. Sacks doesn't believe it will happen.

articles.title: Google names insider Kavukcuoglu to lead AI-powered product development
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Koray Kavukcuoglu, chief technology officer of Google's DeepMind AI lab, is taking on the newly created title of chief AI architect. He will also become a new senior vice president, reporting directly to CEO Sundar Pichai. Google has signed a deal to supply computing capacity to its biggest AI rival OpenAI via its cloud service.

articles.title: Sensitive skin to help robots detect information about surroundings
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: A highly sensitive skin that can be added to robotic hands like a glove has been developed by U.K. researchers. The low-cost, durable skin can enable robots to detect information about their surroundings in a way similar to humans. The flexible, conductive skin is easy to fabricate and can be melted down and formed into a wide range of complex shapes.

articles.title: Disney, Universal sue AI firm for copyright infringement: ‘Bottomless pit of plagiarism'
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Disney and Universal have filed a copyright lawsuit against popular artificial intelligence image-generator Midjourney on Wednesday. The complaint claims the company pirated the libraries of the two Hollywood studios to generate and distribute 'endless unauthorized copies' of their famous characters. It's the first time major Hollywood companies have entered the legal battle over generative AI.

articles.title: People Pretty Much Lost Their Minds When ChatGPT Went Down
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: ChatGPT went down this week, leading to a lot of freakouts on social media. Many people are too dependent on the chatbot to operate normally without it. The outage coincided with Futurism's investigation into ChatGPT delusions, which some people found coincidental.

articles.title: ChatGPT gets ‘wrecked' by a simple 1977 Atari chess program
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: ChatGPT got wrecked on the beginner level. AI tools and assistants are not as smart as they might seem on the surface and ChatGPT is not very useful at all. It's worth remembering that AI tools are still limited and have many shortcomings.

articles.title: Meta's AI-powered ad creative: Game-changer or cautionary tale?
articles.summary: Meta will start using AI to generate ad copy and creative based on an advertiser's goal. EGC Group's CEO sees the potential in AI-powered ad creative, but also the risks. He believes the industry needs to push for greater transparency and accountability in the use of AI in marketing.

articles.title: Disney & NBCUniversal vs. Midjourney: AI Art Lawsuit
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Disney and Universal are suing Midjourney over the use of their intellectual property to train an AI image generator without permission. Similar legal challenges are brewing across various creative fields. The legal framework surrounding AI-generated content is still in its infancy, creating significant uncertainty for both creators and developers.

articles.title: Meta's new AI video tool can put you in a desert (or at least try to)
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Meta is launching new video editing tools that will let you transform videos using AI. The tool is only free for a limited time. It's rolling out now in the US and 'more than a dozen' countries in the Meta AI app, the Meta.AI website, and the Edits app.

articles.title: Investment CEO Tells Convention Audience That 60 Percent of Them Will Be Unemployed Next Year ...
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: 75% of businesses have failed to deliver the return on investment promised to them. Next year, 40% of people at the conference will have an AI agent and the remaining 60% will be looking for work. Hundreds of billions of dollars have been poured into AI development.

articles.title: AI Weekly: Apple plays it safe, OpenAI rakes it in
articles.summary: OpenAI's revenue was $10 billion by June. Meta is hiring a team to build AI that matches or surpasses human abilities. A UN report says indirect carbon emissions from AI-focused firms rose by 150% from 2020-2023. Mark Zuckerberg will personally hire some 50 people to work on the project.

articles.title: Tulsi Gabbard says she used AI to decide which JFK assassination files to release
articles.author: Ariana Baio
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard's office used artificial intelligence to help decide which files should be declassified in the government's investigation into the assassination of John F. Kennedy. In March, the administration released more than 1,100 files as part of the investigation. Some of those files were released without necessary redactions to shield private information.

articles.title: Area health officials promote resources to prevent skin cancer
articles.summary: In the United States, nearly 6 million people are treated for skin cancer each year and about 2,000 to 8,000 people die each year. In Rice and Steele Counties, there are resources available to learn about skin cancer and how to prevent it. On cloudy days, up to 80% of the sun's UV rays can pass through clouds.

articles.title: iOS 26 Apple Intelligence adds anime-style image creation via ChatGPT
articles.summary: iOS 26 improves Apple Intelligence features. Live Translation, ChatGPT improvements, Genmoji and Image Playground updates are some of the new features. Apple has added five custom ChatGpt styles, including: Oil Painting, Watercolor, Vector, Anime and Print.

articles.title: How to Translate Video Efficiently and Accurately with One Click?
articles.author: Sponsored Post
articles.summary: BlipCut AI Video Translator uses speech recognition, language translation, and subtitle timing to translate videos into different languages. It's easy to upload a video and it turns the audio into text automatically. Long videos require more computational power and storage, making the translation process more demanding. BlipCut offers features to address these challenges.

articles.title: Angelo State now offering new AI degree options
articles.author: Rosanna Fraire
articles.summary: Angelo State University has added two new online AI degrees for the fall semester. The bachelor's degree in AI consists of 120 credit hours. The M.S. in AI degree consists of 30 credit hours and includes a capstone project. A new online Certificate in AI Policy and Ethics is also now available.

articles.title: AllSci Wins Grant to Expand AI Platform for Pharma and Biotech R&D: Accelerating Hypothesis-Driven Discovery
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: AllSci, a pioneer in AI-driven tools for scientific research, has been awarded a grant from Montgomery County, Maryland's Technology Innovation Fund. The grant will support the development of AllSci's AI-powered research platform, empowering scientists at every level to formulate hypotheses, validate findings and contribute to the scientific record.

articles.title: Single-material electronic skin gives robots the human touch
articles.author: University
articles.summary: Scientists have developed a low-cost, durable, highly-sensitive robotic 'skin' that can be added to robotic hands like a glove. The technology senses and processes a range of physical inputs, allowing robots to interact with the physical world in a more meaningful way. The results are reported in the journal Science Robotics.

articles.title: Kentucky is among the states stepping into AI regulation, but a provision in the Trump budget bill could press the pause button
articles.author: Wuky
articles.summary: Kentucky convened an AI task force last year and passed Senate Bill 4 to create a "risk-based framework for the responsible use of AI in state government and elections" Sen. Amanda Maya Bledsoe is set to lead a similar panel this year. The Trump spending bill would put a decade-long pause on state AI rulemaking. It would also halt enforcement of most laws that states have passed.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman: ChatGPT ‘already more powerful than any human who has ever lived' in some aspects
articles.author: Ryan Lovelace
articles.summary: OpenAI's Sam Altman wrote on his blog that humanity is close to building superintelligence and AI makers have recently built systems that are smarter than people. Mr. Altman's company is making products for U.S. intelligence and military customers. Microsoft is a large benefactor of OpenAI and has invested billions of dollars in the company.
